parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From para and kaleo; to call near, i.e. Invite, invoke.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From para and the middle voice of a derivative of muthos; to relate near, i.e. encourage, console.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: (properly: To call (summon) to witness, and then absolutely) To testify, protest, asseverate; To conjure, solemnly charge.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From peri and pateo; to tread all around, i.e. Walk at large; figuratively, to live, deport oneself, follow.
Worthily, in a manner worthy of. Adverb from axios; appropriately.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I call, summon, invite, (b) I call, name. Akin to the base of keleuo; to 'call'.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular

str2: From basileus; properly, royalty, i.e. rule, or a realm.
From the base of dokeo; glory, in a wide application.
